data.title: Colleges & Universities in New Jersey
data.meta_description: Looking for the college or university in New Jersey that best fits your needs? Start your search with the 2024 Best Adult Colleges & Careers Guide.
data.text:
Guide to New Jersey Colleges & Universities

Are you in New Jersey searching for the right college or university? Start your search here.

Browse through the list of New Jersey cities and towns below to view schools in your specific area. Or, see a list of New Jersey colleges and universities sorted by private 4-year schools, public 4-year schools, and 2-year community colleges.

The Best Adult Colleges & Careers Guide provides detailed information about colleges and universities, including student type, program completion and online availability. Click here to learn more about the guide.

New Jersey's Colleges by the Numbers

Associate, bachelor's, masters, and doctoral degree completions at institutions in New Jersey have been declining over the past 5 years. In 2022, students completed 87,218 that were offered by New Jersey's colleges and universities. That was a decrease of 0% from completions reported in 2018.

Top School For Adults & Online Students

Franklin University is a top choice for transfer students, online learners and adults who need to balance school with busy lives. Founded in 1902 in Columbus, Ohio, Franklin's main focus has been serving adult students and tailoring education to fit their needs. Nonprofit and accredited by the Higher Learning Commission (hlcommission.org/800.621.7440), Franklin offers more than 50 bachelor's, master's, and doctoral programs — all available 100% online.

Private Colleges & Universities Offering Degrees in New Jersey

There are at least 38 schools offering degrees in New Jersey, and 38 are four-year private colleges or universities where about 51,717 undergraduate students were enrolled. In 2022, a total of 21,294 degrees were completed at private colleges and universities, including 6,661 that were offered online.

In addition, 94 associate degrees, 676 master's degrees, and 39 doctoral degrees were earned.
